pullRequest.body:
This file defines the `AddSubmonoid` of nonegative elements `StarOrderedRing.positive R` in a star ordered ring `R` with carrier `{ x : R | 0 â‰¤ x }` (in fact, the definition only requires `OrderedAddCommMonoid R` to allow for other use cases, but it is primarily intended for `StarOrderedRing R`). Equivalently, this is the `AddSubmonoid` generated by the elements of the form `star s * s`. Even though this technically corresponds to the nonnegative elements, the "positive" terminology is standard throughout the literature (at least in Câ‹†-algebra theory and operator theory), so we choose to prefer that.

The advantage of using this over other definitions of positivity is that it allows us to unify several different concepts under a single umbrella. For example, one might be tempted to consider the collection of bounded linear operators on an Hilbert space and define positivity as `âˆ€ x, 0 â‰¤ âŸªT x, xâŸ«`, but this doesn't generalize nicely to Câ‹†-algebras. Alternatively, one could define positivity as those self-adjoint elements with nonnegative spectrum, but this requires the algebra to be unital. Our definition herein conveniently sidesteps these issues.

---
Note: I declared the `AddMonoidWithOne` and `AddGroupWithOne` instances for `selfAdjoint R` separately because it made the proof of the latter easier.

- [x] depends on: #6229
- [x] depends on: #10209

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#6229~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#10209~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

Just in case anyone sees this PR but not [the Zulip thread](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/116395-maths/topic/!4.234871.20positive.20elements.20in.20a.20star.20ordered.20ring/near/364678287); I'd argue we want instead
```lean
def AddSubmonoid.nonneg (M : Type u) [OrderedAddCommMonoid M] : AddSubmonoid M where
  carrier := {m : M | 0 â‰¤ m}
  zero_mem := le_rfl
  add_mem := add_nonneg
```
which as I understand it is strictly more general. This could probably go in `Mathlib/Algebra/Order/Nonneg/Ring.lean`.
I think this result should probably also exist as a `lemma StarOrderedRing.IsSelfAdjoint_of_nonneg`, in `Mathlib/Algebra/Star/Order.lean`
I added it, but left it in `Positive.lean` because otherwise I would need to import `SelfAdjoint.lean` into `Order.lean`
Is this actually annoying for a use case you have in mind?
Admittedly no, it's just that this kind of modest lack of generality seems to continually come back to bite me later. I've removed that comment.
I'm happy with the comment if you feel strongly; I ran into this too but also had no real justification for the generalization.
Isn't this `exists_add_iff_le` or something? Maybe I've imagined that we actually have that

We have [le_iff_exists_add](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Order/Monoid/Canonical/Defs.html#le_iff_exists_add), but this has no nonnegativity condition and requires a `CanonicallyOrderedAddMonoid`, and we have [le_iff_exists_nonneg_add](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Order/Ring/Defs.html#le_iff_exists_nonneg_add), but that requries an `OrderedRing`.

However, it should be possible to add a non-strict version of the lemma [exists_pos_add_of_lt'](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Order/Monoid/Canonical/Defs.html#exists_pos_add_of_lt') under a `ContravariantClass Î± Î± (Â· + Â·) (Â· â‰¤ Â·)`. That being said, it doesn't really help us here because I think we can't conclude that without the `OrderedAddCommGroup` instance when we have a `NonUnitalRing` (instead of a `NonUnitalSemiring`).

One possible solution would be to hardcode the `ContravariantClass` condition into the definition of `StarOrderedRing` (I can't think of any counterexamples where we would want a `StarOrderedRing` class but it doesn't satisfy the `ContravariantClass` condition, but perhaps I'm just not thinking hard enough), but that requires another change to the definition.
I think this could do with a docstring
I'd argue this belongs in nonneg/ring, as it can be used to golf some instances there

I've put this (and one for `Subsemiring`) in the appropriate subobject files; I didn't place them in `Algebra.Order.Nonneg.Ring` in order to avoid import creep. Now `StarOrderedRing.positive` is just an alias for `AddSubmonoid.nonneg`, but we keep a separate name because we prefer it and also because we will place many instances on it.
This belongs in the previous section without the star assumptions
Is this `Subtype.exists` from here?
Thanks! I was looking for that and didn't find it, but now I realized I could have just `simp`ed to get there.
I think it's probably best to define this first and then build the new instance out of it using `Function.Injective.addCommMonoidWithOne`
Is `alias` a good idea for `def`s? I have no idea how it works in Lean 4, and would have gone for `abbrev` myself. That way you could also force an unused `StarOrderedRing` argument

My understanding is that `alias` is equivalent to:
```lean
def newName same_hypothesesas_as_oldName := oldName
```
so in particular it has `default` transparency, as opposed to `reducible`, which is what I would get with `abbrev`. I think that's what we want. And to allow for Moritz to maybe use unbounded operators, I have left out the hypothesis `StarOrderedRing`.
I don't see what we gain by not making it be reducible.

It prevents us from accidentally acquiring instances from `AddSubmonoid.nonneg` on `StarOrderedRing.positive`. My bet is that it's a non-issue, but potentially annoyingly difficult to debug if it ever does arise. Moreover, I would prefer not to see `AddSubmonoid.nonneg` as the result of some `whnfR` just because this is at reducible transparency. I'm not sure why being reducible would benefit us in this situation. I'm open to being wrong here.
I think I'd prefer to see these changes backported (i.e., PRed to mathlib3 first), just in case.
At this point, given all the changes to already ported files, I'm expecting this not to be merged until after the port, hence I didn't bother.
That makes sense to me!

```suggestion
In addition, we note that `StarOrderedRing.positive` is just an alias of `AddSubmonoid.nonneg`, but
```
Isn't this just [`Nonneg.canonicallyOrderedAddMonoid`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Order/Nonneg/Ring.html#Nonneg.canonicallyOrderedAddMonoid)?
No, that requires an `OrderedRing` instance (although I didn't actually check if it's necessary).
This looks like a bad definition that is going to cause algebra diamonds to me. Can you use `âŸ¨n, n.cast_nonneg'âŸ©` directly?
Can you get any of these by generalizing the results in `Mathlib/Algebra/Order/Nonneg/Ring.lean`?

pullRequest.title: feat: define the additive submonoid of positive elements in a star ordered ring

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: generalize a few `Nat.cast` lemmas
[Merged by Bors] - feat: Submonoid of nonnegative elements
